server.description: MCP server for 1ly.store — buy/sell APIs and launch tokens on Bags.fm with USDC & $1LY.

environmentVariables.description: Path to Solana keypair JSON file (e.g. /home/user/.1ly/wallets/solana.json) or inline JSON byte array. Required for paid API calls and token tools (launch, trade, claim). Note: Claude Desktop does not expand ~, use absolute paths.
environmentVariables.name: ONELY_WALLET_SOLANA_KEY

environmentVariables.description: Path to EVM private key file or 0x-prefixed hex string. Required for payments on Base network.
environmentVariables.name: ONELY_WALLET_EVM_KEY

environmentVariables.description: 1ly.store seller API key. Auto-saved locally after running the 1ly_create_store tool — you do not need to set this manually. Required for seller tools: manage links, stats, withdrawals, keys, and profile.
environmentVariables.name: ONELY_API_KEY

environmentVariables.description: Wallet provider to use. 'raw' (default) uses local key files via ONELY_WALLET_SOLANA_KEY or ONELY_WALLET_EVM_KEY. 'coinbase' uses Coinbase Agentic Wallet (Base network only, requires the wallet app running locally).
environmentVariables.name: ONELY_WALLET_PROVIDER

environmentVariables.description: Preferred blockchain network for payments. 'solana' (default) or 'base'. Determines which wallet is used when an API supports both networks.
environmentVariables.name: ONELY_NETWORK

environmentVariables.description: Solana RPC endpoint URL. Defaults to https://api.mainnet-beta.solana.com. Use a private RPC (e.g. Helius, Quicknode) for better reliability and rate limits.
environmentVariables.name: ONELY_SOLANA_RPC_URL

environmentVariables.description: Maximum USD amount allowed per single paid API call. Defaults to 1.00. The server will refuse any call priced above this limit.
environmentVariables.name: ONELY_BUDGET_PER_CALL

environmentVariables.description: Maximum total USD spending per calendar day (UTC). Defaults to 50.00. Resets at UTC midnight. The server will refuse calls that would exceed this limit.
environmentVariables.name: ONELY_BUDGET_DAILY

environmentVariables.description: Path to the local JSON file used to track daily spending. Defaults to ~/.1ly-mcp-budget.json. Created automatically with owner-only permissions (0600).
environmentVariables.name: ONELY_BUDGET_STATE_FILE

environmentVariables.description: Set to '1' to simulate Solana transactions without broadcasting to the blockchain. Returns a fake signature. Use for testing only — no real payments will be made.
environmentVariables.name: ONELY_SOLANA_DRY_RUN

environmentVariables.description: Override the 1ly.store API base URL. Defaults to https://1ly.store. Only http://localhost:PORT is accepted as an alternative (for local development). Do not change in production.
environmentVariables.name: ONELY_API_BASE

server.name: io.github.Couchbase-Ecosystem/mcp-server-couchbase

packageArguments.description: Couchbase connection string. Required for connecting to the cluster.
packageArguments.name: --connection-string

packageArguments.description: Couchbase database username. Required for basic authentication.
packageArguments.name: --username

packageArguments.description: Couchbase database password. Required for basic authentication.
packageArguments.name: --password

packageArguments.description: Couchbase CA certificate path. Required for TLS authentication in non Capella clusters.

packageArguments.description: Couchbase client certificate path. Required for mTLS authentication.
packageArguments.name: --client-cert-path

packageArguments.description: Couchbase client key path. Required for mTLS authentication.
packageArguments.name: --client-key-path

packageArguments.description: Couchbase read only mode. Set to true to disable write operations across both KV and query. KV write tools are not loaded and SQL++ queries that modify data are blocked. Set to false to allow data modification queries and tools.
packageArguments.name: --read-only-mode

packageArguments.description: [Deprecated] Couchbase read only query mode. Set to true to allow only read-only queries. Set to false to allow data modification queries. Use --read-only-mode instead.

packageArguments.description: Transport mode for the server (stdio, http or sse). Default is stdio
packageArguments.name: --transport

packageArguments.description: Host to run the MCP server on (default: 127.0.0.1). Used only for HTTP and SSE transport modes.
packageArguments.name: --host

packageArguments.description: Port to run the MCP server on (default: 8000). Used only for HTTP and SSE transport modes.
packageArguments.name: --port

packageArguments.description: Tools to disable. Accepts comma-separated tool names (e.g., 'tool_1,tool_2') or a file path containing one tool name per line.
packageArguments.name: --disabled-tools

server.name: io.github.lvpiggyqq/xcatcher
server.description: High-throughput X/Twitter crawl via tasks; download XLSX; x402 USDC Base/Solana top-ups.

headers.description: Bearer xc_live_... API key (required).
headers.name: Authorization

headers.description: application/json (required).
headers.name: Accept

headers.description: application/json (required for JSON-RPC POST).
headers.name: Content-Type

billingNotes: Task billing (docs default): normal = 1 point/user; deep = 10 points/user. Actual cost is returned by create responses.
When MCP returns 402 PAYMENT_REQUIRED, pay using quote_id + on-chain proof, call x402_topup, then retry with the same idempotency_key.
compatibilityNotes: If CSV is needed, convert the downloaded XLSX to CSV client-side.
highlights: Optimized for batch 'latest posts' retrieval across large sets of X users
Task-based flow: submit task → poll status → download result file
Results are provided as XLSX. If CSV is needed, convert the downloaded XLSX to CSV client-side
Supports x402 top-ups (USDC on Base or Solana) when points are insufficient (handle 402 then retry)

modes.deep: Deeper per-user collection/enrichment (slower; higher resource usage).
modes.normal: Fast latest-post snapshot at scale (fresh-feed monitoring).

performanceNotes: Typical benchmark (Normal): ~1000 users → ~5000 tweets in ~2 minutes under normal conditions.
Actual throughput depends on time window, X platform rate limits, and network conditions. For very large sets, split into multiple tasks.

environmentVariables.description: [Map] Google Map API key
environmentVariables.name: MT_GOOGLE_MAP_KEY

environmentVariables.description: [Image.gemini] Gemini Image Api key
environmentVariables.name: MT_GEMINI_IMAGE_KEY

environmentVariables.description: [Image.gemini] Number of retries when generating Gemini images Default: 0
environmentVariables.name: MT_MAX_RETRY_GEMINI

environmentVariables.description: [Image.gemini] Character reference image uri (file:// or https://) when generating Gemini image. Multiple settings can be made by separating them with the '|'. When multiple settings are made, they will be selected randomly.
environmentVariables.name: MT_AVATAR_IMAGE_URI

environmentVariables.description: [Map.etc] Optional: Map API custom endpoint. Example: direction=https://xxxx,places=https://yyyy
environmentVariables.name: MT_MAP_API_URL

environmentVariables.description: [Map] Optional:Scale of travel time on real roads duration. default 4
environmentVariables.name: MT_TIME_SCALE

environmentVariables.description: [db.local] db save path: e.g. %USERPROFILE%/Desktop/traveler.sqlite ,$HOME/traveler.sqlite
environmentVariables.name: MT_SQLITE_PATH

environmentVariables.description: [db.api] Turso sqlite API URL
environmentVariables.name: MT_TURSO_URL

environmentVariables.description: [db.api] Turso sqlite API access token
environmentVariables.name: MT_TURSO_TOKEN

environmentVariables.description: [rembg.local] absolute path of the installed rembg cli
environmentVariables.name: MT_REMBG_PATH

environmentVariables.description: [rembg.api] withoutbg.com rembg API URL
environmentVariables.name: MT_REMBG_URL

environmentVariables.description: [rembg.api] withoutbg.com rembg API key
environmentVariables.name: MT_REMBG_WO_KEY

environmentVariables.description: [Image.pixAi] pixAi API key
environmentVariables.name: MT_PIXAI_KEY

environmentVariables.description: [Image.sd] Stability.ai image generation API key
environmentVariables.name: MT_SD_KEY

environmentVariables.description: [Image.pixAi] Optional: pixAi ModelId, if not set use default model 1648918127446573124
environmentVariables.name: MT_PIXAI_MODEL_ID

environmentVariables.description: [Image.local.ComfyUi] Option: Generate image using ComfyUI API at specified URL. Example: http://192.168.1.100:8188
environmentVariables.name: MT_COMFY_URL

environmentVariables.description: [Image.local.ComfyUi] Optional: Path to API workflow file when using text to image with ComfyUI. If not specified: assets/comfy/t2i_sample.json
environmentVariables.name: MT_COMFY_WORKFLOW_T2I

environmentVariables.description: [Image.local.ComfyUi] Optional: Path of API workflow file when image to image in ComfyUI. If not specified: assets/comfy/i2i_sample.json
environmentVariables.name: MT_COMFY_WORKFLOW_I2I

environmentVariables.description: [Image.local.ComfyUi] Optional: Variable values to send to the workflow via comfyUI API
environmentVariables.name: MT_COMFY_PARAMS

environmentVariables.description: [Image] Optional: Fixed avatar generation prompt. You will no longer be able to change your avatar during conversations.
environmentVariables.name: MT_FIXED_MODEL_PROMPT

environmentVariables.description: [Image] Optional: Acceptable avatar image area ratio. default 0.042
environmentVariables.name: MT_BODY_AREA_RATIO

environmentVariables.description: [Image] Optional: Acceptable avatar image aspect ratios. default 1.5~2.3
environmentVariables.name: MT_BODY_HW_RATIO

environmentVariables.description: [Image] Optional: Avatar composite window horizontal ratio. default 0.5
environmentVariables.name: MT_BODY_WINDOW_RATIO_W

environmentVariables.description: [Image] Optional: Avatar composite window aspect ratio. default 0.75
environmentVariables.name: MT_BODY_WINDOW_RATIO_H

environmentVariables.description: [Sns.Bs] Bluesky sns registration address
environmentVariables.name: MT_BS_ID

environmentVariables.description: [Sns.Bs] bluesky sns password
environmentVariables.name: MT_BS_PASS

environmentVariables.description: [Sns.Bs] bluesky sns handle name: e.g. xxxxxxxx.bsky.social
environmentVariables.name: MT_BS_HANDLE

packageArguments.description: When set to true, allows configuration values to be overridden via request headers and query parameters.
packageArguments.name: --allowRequestOverrides

packageArguments.description: Atlas API client ID for authentication. Required for running Atlas tools.
packageArguments.name: --apiClientId

packageArguments.description: Atlas API client secret for authentication. Required for running Atlas tools.
packageArguments.name: --apiClientSecret

packageArguments.description: Time in milliseconds that temporary database users created when connecting to MongoDB Atlas clusters will remain active before being automatically deleted.
packageArguments.name: --atlasTemporaryDatabaseUserLifetimeMs

packageArguments.description: Comma separated values of tool names that require user confirmation before execution. Requires the client to support elicitation.
packageArguments.name: --confirmationRequiredTools

packageArguments.description: MongoDB connection string for direct database connections. Optional, if not set, you'll need to call the connect tool before interacting with MongoDB data.
packageArguments.name: --connectionString

packageArguments.description: Comma separated values of tool names, operation types, and/or categories of tools that will be disabled.
packageArguments.name: --disabledTools

packageArguments.description: When true, runs the server in dry mode: dumps configuration and enabled tools, then exits without starting the server.
packageArguments.name: --dryRun

packageArguments.description: When set to false, disables validation of embeddings dimensions.
packageArguments.name: --embeddingsValidation

packageArguments.description: Time in milliseconds between export cleanup cycles that remove expired export files.
packageArguments.name: --exportCleanupIntervalMs

packageArguments.description: Time in milliseconds after which an export is considered expired and eligible for cleanup.
packageArguments.name: --exportTimeoutMs

packageArguments.description: Folder to store exported data files.
packageArguments.name: --exportsPath

packageArguments.description: When true, the HTTP transport allows requests with a session ID supplied externally through the 'mcp-session-id' header. When an external ID is supplied, the initialization request is optional.
packageArguments.name: --externallyManagedSessions

packageArguments.description: Host address to bind the healthCheck HTTP server to (only used when transport is 'http'). If provided, `healthCheckPort` must also be set.
packageArguments.name: --healthCheckHost

packageArguments.description: Port number for the healthCheck HTTP server (only used when transport is 'http'). If provided, `healthCheckHost` must also be set.
packageArguments.name: --healthCheckPort

packageArguments.description: Maximum size of the HTTP request body in bytes (only used when transport is 'http'). This value is passed as the optional limit parameter to the Express.js json() middleware.
packageArguments.name: --httpBodyLimit

packageArguments.description: Header that the HTTP server will validate when making requests (only used when transport is 'http').
packageArguments.name: --httpHeaders

packageArguments.description: Host address to bind the HTTP server to (only used when transport is 'http').
packageArguments.name: --httpHost

packageArguments.description: Port number for the HTTP server (only used when transport is 'http'). Use 0 for a random port.
packageArguments.name: --httpPort

packageArguments.description: The HTTP response type for tool responses: 'sse' for Server-Sent Events, 'json' for standard JSON responses.
packageArguments.name: --httpResponseType

packageArguments.description: Idle timeout for a client to disconnect (only applies to http transport).
packageArguments.name: --idleTimeoutMs

packageArguments.description: When set to true, enforces that query operations must use an index, rejecting queries that perform a collection scan.
packageArguments.name: --indexCheck

packageArguments.description: Folder to store logs.
packageArguments.name: --logPath

packageArguments.description: Comma separated values of logger types.
packageArguments.name: --loggers

packageArguments.description: The maximum size in bytes for results from a find or aggregate tool call. This serves as an upper bound for the responseBytesLimit parameter in those tools.
packageArguments.name: --maxBytesPerQuery

packageArguments.description: The maximum number of documents that can be returned by a find or aggregate tool call. For the find tool, the effective limit will be the smaller of this value and the tool's limit parameter.
packageArguments.name: --maxDocumentsPerQuery

packageArguments.description: Notification timeout for a client to be aware of disconnect (only applies to http transport).
packageArguments.name: --notificationTimeoutMs

packageArguments.description: Comma separated values of preview features that are enabled.
packageArguments.name: --previewFeatures

packageArguments.description: When set to true, only allows read, connect, and metadata operation types, disabling create/update/delete operations.
packageArguments.name: --readOnly

packageArguments.description: When set to disabled, disables telemetry collection.
